Just tried to solve it again more than a year after I published it, and i stumbled into a problem with the following (very much not optimized!) solution:

```
import re

text = input().replace("'", "")
text = re.sub(r"[A-Z]", lambda m: m[0].lower(), text)
while m := re.search(r"([a-z])[\s-]+([a-z])", text):
    text = text[:m.start()] + m[1] + m[2].upper() + text[m.end():]

print(text)
```

This is incorrect because the pattern in the while should also match capital letters for the first group, since one-letter words can already be capitalized (i.e. "may I do this" is incorrectly converted into "mayI doThis" instead of "mayIDoThis"). This was detected by validator 2, but not test 2, so I changed the validator to only use multiple letter words. Single-letter words are validated by both test and validator 3, so everything behaves correctly now.
